intro: Centropogon laciniatus, commonly known as the lacerate centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, attracting various pollinators. The species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
